question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson chooses a female running mate for the 2024 election and (b) Tucker Carlson is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By November 5, 2024, Tucker Carlson officially announces a female running mate for the 2024 election, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The running mate must be named and publicly recognized as part of his campaign for the presidency. Any speculation or informal mentions do not count; the announcement must be a formal endorsement and acceptance of the role. (b) Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, it will resolve as No. This is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Tucker Carlson choose a female running mate for the 2024 election?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Tucker Carlson will choose a female running mate for the 2024 election if, by November 5, 2024, he officially announces a female running mate, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources. The announcement must be formal, naming the running mate as part of his campaign.

question.title: Will any major Republican candidate drop out of the race before the primaries in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any major Republican candidate, defined as one who has received at least 5% support in national polling prior to the primaries, officially announces their withdrawal from the race before February 1, 2024. The announcement must be made through a credible source, such as a press conference or a statement on a major news outlet (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Candidates who suspend their campaigns but do not formally drop out will not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) no major Republican candidate drop out of the race before the primaries in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) No major Republican candidate, defined as one who has received at least 5% support in national polling prior to the primaries, officially announces their withdrawal from the race before February 1, 2024. The announcement must be made through a credible source, such as a press conference or a statement on a major news outlet. Candidates who suspend their campaigns but do not formally drop out will not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will either a major Republican candidate drop out before the 2024 primaries or Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Any major Republican candidate, defined as one who has received at least 5% support in national polling prior to the primaries, officially announces their withdrawal from the race before February 1, 2024. The announcement must be made through a credible source, such as a press conference or a statement on a major news outlet (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Candidates who suspend their campaigns but do not formally drop out will not count towards this resolution. (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson run for President in the 2024 election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Tucker Carlson has officially declared his candidacy for President of the United States for the 2024 election. An official declaration must be made through a public announcement or filing with the Federal Election Commission (FEC). Any credible reports from at least two major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or similar) confirming his candidacy will also suffice. If he is a candidate in any capacity (e.g., primary elections) without an official declaration, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Tucker Carlson does not run for President in the 2024 election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) by November 5, 2024, Tucker Carlson has not officially declared his candidacy for President of the United States for the 2024 election. 

For condition (a), any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. It is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (b), an official declaration must not be made through a public announcement or filing with the Federal Election Commission (FEC). There must be no credible reports from at least two major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or similar) confirming his candidacy. If he is a candidate in any capacity (e.g., primary elections) without an official declaration, the question will resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson either run for President or be the Republican nominee in the 2024 election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) Tucker Carlson officially declares his candidacy for President of the United States for the 2024 election by November 5, 2024. An official declaration must be made through a public announcement or filing with the Federal Election Commission (FEC), or credible reports from at least two major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or similar) confirm his candidacy. If he is a candidate in any capacity (e.g., primary elections) without an official declaration, this part will resolve as No. (2) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve this part as No. This selection is solely determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Any other media personalities enter the Republican nomination race for 2024 (b) Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By December 31, 2024, any individual who is a media personality (defined as someone who is widely recognized in the media, including television, radio, or online platforms) officially announces their candidacy for the Republican nomination for President of the United States. An official announcement must be made publicly, such as through a press conference, a verified social media account, or a news article from a reputable source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The term 'media personality' includes but is not limited to television hosts, radio show hosts, and prominent online influencers. The resolution will not count individuals who only express interest without a formal announcement or who are already declared candidates. Additionally, if multiple media personalities declare their candidacy simultaneously, the resolution will still count as Yes if at least one meets the criteria. (b) Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, it will resolve as No. This condition is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will any other media personalities enter the Republican nomination race for 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) by December 31, 2024, any individual who is a media personality (defined as someone who is widely recognized in the media, including television, radio, or online platforms) officially announces their candidacy for the Republican nomination for President of the United States. 

For (a), the question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For (b), an official announcement must be made publicly, such as through a press conference, a verified social media account, or a news article from a reputable source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The term 'media personality' includes but is not limited to television hosts, radio show hosts, and prominent online influencers. The resolution will not count individuals who only express interest without a formal announcement or who are already declared candidates. Additionally, if multiple media personalities declare their candidacy simultaneously, the resolution will still count as Yes if at least one meets the criteria.

question.title: Will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024 and will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By November 5, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election. This must be confirmed by a public announcement or through a filing with the Federal Election Commission (FEC), and widely reported by reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Participation in any primary elections or the general election will also serve as confirmation of his candidacy. Unofficial statements or speculation do not count. (2) None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Trump family influences the Republican platform in 2024 (b) No member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met:

1. There is clear and documented evidence that the Trump family has significantly influenced the Republican Party platform for the 2024 election. This includes:
   - The inclusion of specific policy proposals or positions in the official Republican Party platform that can be directly attributed to the Trump family or their representatives.
   - Public statements or endorsements from key Trump family members (e.g., Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Donald Trump Jr.) that are recognized and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) indicating their influence on the platform.
   - Any formal resolutions or actions taken by the Republican National Committee (RNC) or state party organizations that reflect Trump family priorities.
   - The influence must be significant enough to be acknowledged by political analysts or experts in reputable political commentary or analysis outlets. Minor endorsements or unofficial statements will not count towards this resolution.

2. None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

- Any formal resolutions or actions taken by the Republican National Committee (RNC) or state party organizations that reflect Trump family priorities.

The influence must be significant enough to be acknowledged by political analysts or experts in reputable political commentary or analysis outlets. Minor endorsements or unofficial statements will not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will Ivanka Trump hold a significant political office by 2025?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Ivanka Trump is officially appointed to a significant political office within the United States government. A 'significant political office' is defined as any role that requires confirmation by the Senate or is a Cabinet-level position, including but not limited to Secretary of State, Secretary of Treasury, or any position with equivalent authority and responsibility. The appointment must be confirmed by an official announcement from the White House or relevant government body. If she holds an elected position, such as a member of Congress or a state governor, this will also count as a Yes. Any role that is considered ceremonial or advisory, such as ambassadorial positions without significant policy-making power, will not count towards this resolution.

The appointment must be confirmed by an official announcement from the White House or relevant government body. If Ivanka Trump does not hold an elected position, such as a member of Congress or a state governor, this will also count as meeting the second condition. Ceremonial or advisory roles without significant policy-making power, such as certain ambassadorial positions, will not count towards this resolution.

question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, there is clear and documented evidence that the Trump family has significantly influenced the Republican Party platform for the 2024 election. This includes:

- The inclusion of specific policy proposals or positions in the official Republican Party platform that can be directly attributed to the Trump family or their representatives.
- Public statements or endorsements from key Trump family members (e.g., Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Donald Trump Jr.) that are recognized and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) indicating their influence on the platform.
- Any formal resolutions or actions taken by the Republican National Committee (RNC) or state party organizations that reflect Trump family priorities.

The influence must be significant enough to be acknowledged by political analysts or experts in reputable political commentary or analysis outlets. Minor endorsements or unofficial statements will not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump secure the nomination by winning at least 50% of the delegates in the primaries?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has secured at least 50% of the total delegates available in the Republican primaries for the 2024 presidential election. The total number of delegates is defined as the sum of all delegates awarded through primaries and caucuses, as officially reported by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The delegate count must be confirmed by reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, or major political news outlets. In the event of a tie or ambiguity in delegate counts, the resolution will be based on the latest official delegate tally provided by the RNC. If Donald Trump is disqualified or suspended from the primaries, this question will resolve as No.

(b) This part will resolve as Yes if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not secured at least 50% of the total delegates available in the Republican primaries. The delegate count is defined by the sum of all delegates awarded through primaries and caucuses as reported by the RNC. Reputable news sources will confirm the count. If Trump is disqualified or suspended, this resolves as Yes.

This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: 

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has secured at least 50% of the total delegates available in the Republican primaries for the 2024 presidential election. The total number of delegates is defined as the sum of all delegates awarded through primaries and caucuses, as officially reported by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The delegate count must be confirmed by reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, or major political news outlets. In the event of a tie or ambiguity in delegate counts, the resolution will be based on the latest official delegate tally provided by the RNC. If Donald Trump is disqualified or suspended from the primaries, this part will resolve as No.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This part will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This part may consider new candidates added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major scandal emerges that impacts Donald Trump's chances of being the nominee in 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By December 31, 2024, a major scandal is reported that significantly impacts Donald Trump's chances of securing the Republican nomination for the 2024 presidential election. A 'major scandal' is defined as any event or revelation that leads to substantial negative media coverage, public backlash, or political repercussions that could alter his standing among Republican voters. The impact must be assessed based on credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) and must be recognized by political analysts or experts in the field. If the scandal is deemed to have a lasting effect on his candidacy, this condition will be satisfied. Temporary controversies or minor incidents that do not significantly alter the political landscape will not count. (2) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition will be satisfied. This condition considers any new candidates added in the future. The resolution is not based on who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election, but solely on who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will a major scandal emerge that impacts his chances?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the election day. (b) By December 31, 2024, a major scandal is reported that significantly impacts Donald Trump's chances of securing the Republican nomination for the 2024 presidential election. A 'major scandal' is defined as any event or revelation that leads to substantial negative media coverage, public backlash, or political repercussions that could alter his standing among Republican voters. The impact must be assessed based on credible news reports from at least three major news organizations and must be recognized by political analysts or experts. If the scandal has a lasting effect on his candidacy, this part will resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will Donald Trump run a competitive campaign against the Democratic nominee in the general election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump is officially running as the Republican nominee in the 2024 United States presidential election and is considered competitive against the Democratic nominee based on the following criteria: 1. Polling: Trump must be within 5 percentage points of the Democratic nominee in at least three reputable national polls conducted in the month leading up to the election. 2. Fundraising: Trump must have raised at least $100 million for his campaign by the end of October 2024, as reported by a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times). 3. Public Perception: Trump must maintain a favorable rating of at least 40% among likely voters according to reputable polling data. The resolution will be based on official announcements and reputable news coverage, and any ambiguity in the term 'competitive' will be clarified by the above criteria.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and not run a competitive campaign against the Democratic nominee in the general election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) By November 5, 2024, Donald Trump is not considered competitive against the Democratic nominee based on the following criteria: (a) Polling: Trump is not within 5 percentage points of the Democratic nominee in at least three reputable national polls conducted in the month leading up to the election. (b) Fundraising: Trump has not raised at least $100 million for his campaign by the end of October 2024, as reported by reputable news sources. (c) Public Perception: Trump does not maintain a favorable rating of at least 40% among likely voters according to reputable polling data. The resolution will be based on official announcements and reputable news coverage, and any ambiguity in the term 'competitive' will be clarified by the above criteria.

question.title: Will Donald Trump either run a competitive campaign against the Democratic nominee in the general election or be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) By November 5, 2024, Donald Trump is officially running as the Republican nominee in the 2024 United States presidential election and is considered competitive against the Democratic nominee based on the following criteria: 1. Polling: Trump must be within 5 percentage points of the Democratic nominee in at least three reputable national polls conducted in the month leading up to the election. 2. Fundraising: Trump must have raised at least $100 million for his campaign by the end of October 2024, as reported by a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times). 3. Public Perception: Trump must maintain a favorable rating of at least 40% among likely voters according to reputable polling data. The resolution will be based on official announcements and reputable news coverage, and any ambiguity in the term 'competitive' will be clarified by the above criteria. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.
